news.title: Storm Bram: Met Éireann extends Status Orange warnings to entire country; dozens of flights cancelled; travel disruption for commuters
Associates of drugs gang suspected of over a dozen firebombings probed over Offaly petrol-bomb attack that killed boy (4)
news.summary: Associates of a drugs gang being investigated over the arson attack that killed a young boy and his grand-aunt in Offaly are suspected of carrying out more than a dozen firebombings.

news.title: HSE offers €750 to victims of 2021 cyberattack which affected 90,000 people
news.summary: The HSE is offering victims of its 2021 ransomware attack €750 in compensation, a move that could lead to further payouts of over €100m from the cyber incident.

news.title: David W Higgins: Taxi drivers need to get over ‘go-slow’ protests and embrace fixed pricing
news.summary: There’s a buzz when you land in a new European city, especially one further east where prices are cheaper. As a group of us walked out of Bratislava airport at Easter, we faced that timeless choice: do we hail or open the apps? Fixed price or metre?

news.title: How soaring cattle prices brought down a €16m Munster cattle-buying firm
news.summary: The news that Nicholas Galvin Ltd, a major dairy and beef finishing firm based in Kilmacthomas, Co Waterford, entered provisional liquidation in November sent ripples through the cattle sector.

news.title: Report finds no evidence of collusion in Dublin-Monaghan bombings, challenges UK government to name ‘Stakeknife’ agent
news.summary: A report dealing with some of the most controversial aspects of the Troubles has found no evidence of collusion on the part of the British state in the 1974 Dublin-Monaghan bombings.

news.title: ‘In a lot of cases there isn’t enough income there for both of them to start afresh’: Who gets the house in a divorce?
news.summary: Catherine (53) and a mother of three, says. “I fully expected when we decided to divorce that the house would be half his, even though the deeds were in my name,” she says.

news.title: Kirsty Blake Knox: Meghan Markle’s estrangement from her father has taken another tragic turn
news.summary: Back in May 2018 I was sent to Slough to cover what was being described as the wedding of the year. In the neighbouring town of Windsor, Meghan Markle and Prince Harry were set to get married.

news.title: Restaurant review: Unbeatable 10th floor views, snazzy interiors and an upmarket menu (just make sure to preorder wines over €1,000)
news.summary: Dublin now has its tallest restaurant – Díon on the 10th floor of the Sam Stephenson designed former Central Bank on Dame Street. Perched 150 feet up, it may be the baby of them all but nonetheless the views out over our fair city are pretty dramatic.

news.title: Everyone’s talking about: Parasocial relationships – but is the false intimacy fuelled by social media harmful?
news.summary: When Lily Allen released her album  West End Girl , it offered fans a warts-and-all insight into the breakdown of her marriage to actor David Harbour. While some critics accused Allen of oversharing, millions of people became personally invested in the demise of the relationship.
